meanings.definition: The act or fact of surviving, especially under adverse or unusual circumstances.
meanings.sent1: During the earthquake, their survivals were a testament to their strength and resilience.
meanings.sent2: The survivals of the hiker lost in the wilderness were celebrated by the whole town.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show joked about the survivals of a clumsy character in a series of unfortunate events.
meanings.sent4: In the face of adversity, her survivals shone like beacons of hope in the darkness.
meanings.sent5: The survivals of the shipwreck were etched in the minds of the rescued sailors forever.

meanings.definition: Something that has survived from an earlier period or time.
meanings.sent1: The ancient ruins are remarkable survivals of a once-great civilization.
meanings.sent2: The survivals of ancient artifacts provide valuable insights into history.
meanings.sent3: The museum displayed the survivals of a bygone era with pride and reverence.
meanings.sent4: Her antique necklace was a beautiful survival from her grandmother's jewelry collection.
meanings.sent5: The survivals of the past whispered stories of times long gone to those who listened.

meanings.definition: The remaining parts or remnants of something.
meanings.sent1: The survivals of the old building were carefully preserved during the renovation.
meanings.sent2: After the fire, only the survivals of the family photos remained intact.
meanings.sent3: The survivals of the cake disappeared quickly at the birthday party.
meanings.sent4: The survivals of the shipwreck were scattered along the shore, telling a tale of tragedy.
meanings.sent5: Among the survivals of the ancient manuscript, a hidden message was waiting to be discovered.
